PhD student | Department of Ricerca e Innovazione Umanistica, University of Bari Aldo Moro | Associate researcher, CNR - Istituto di Scienze del Patrimonio Culturale, Area della Ricerca Roma 1.

title: About
text:
Hi!
I am currently conducting a PhD at the University of Bari Aldo Moro in collaboration with CNR-ISPC. My research interests mainly concern the application of quantitative and computer science methods to archaeology, with a specific focus on the application of unsupervised learning methods to ceramics.



Quantitative approach in archaeology
Bronze and Iron Age
Machine Learning application in archaeology
GIS application in archaeology

title: Publications
text:

2020
Cardarelli L., Capienza delle forme vascolari, da un metodo open source all’uso di modelli regressivi: il caso dell’insediamento protostorico del Monte Cimino. Archeologia e Calcolatori, 31.1 [url][pdf]

title: Lorenzo Cardarelli
text:
About me
Hi!
I am currently conducting a PhD at the University of Bari Aldo Moro (PhD course in Patrimoni archeologici, storici architettonici e paesaggistici mediterranei) in collaboration with CNR-ISPC. My research interests mainly concern the application of quantitative and computer science methods to archaeology, with a specific focus on the application of unsupervised learning methods to ceramics.

Research Interests

Quantitative approach in archaeology
Bronze and Iron Age
Machine Learning application in archaeology
GIS application in archaeology

title: Finley Malloc
text:
Finley Malloc is the Chief Data Scientist at Wengo Analytics. When not innovating on data platforms, Finley enjoys spending time unicycling and playing with her pet iguana.


University of California, San Diego | San Diego, CA PhD in Mathematics | Sept 2011 - June 2015
Macalester College | St. Paul MA B.A in Economics | Sept 2007 - June 2011



Wengo Analytics | Head Data Scientist | April 2018 - present
GeoScynce | Chief Analyst | Sept 2012 - April 2018
